column5: yea, someone forgot the chlorine in the pool today! yuck!!!  I like the pros there, but only when its an equally skilled field, ex: hockey and baseball when it comes back, do not like when its a stacked deck like in basketball. i mean, your supposed to send your top athletes.  With hockey, its a crap shoot with who will win, great players from all around the world.  Baseball, you know Japan, Dominican, Puerto Rico, Cuba, US, Canada, and Australia will be highly competative, With Japan being a favourite.  Really liking the indoor volleyball this year,  if you haven't seen it, watch a match, crazy ball speeds, with some big players.

Beach vball is another sport I enjoy watching. The Americans, Brasillians, Dutch, and Italians usually are the top teams. Italy's Carambula sure is entertaining to watch with his sky ball serves!  On a side note, Toronto is hosting an int'l beach vball tournament in Sept that's free to attend. I'd highly recommend going!
Lol. Injuries are bound to happen if you don't warm up and do stretches. Lol.

Court vball has some seriously skilled beasts lol. I had a chance to watch the Canadian men's upset the powerhouse American team. I've seen int'l competition before, but some fellas have really pushed beyond the boundaries with their top spin jump serves. It's already pretty deceiving with the top spin jump serve and it just drops in front of the passer. Watching Hoag's serving is a thing of beauty where it doesn't just have a top spin, but also side spin making the ball curve! I can't recall how fast the speed was, but definitely putting out smoke rings!  Beach vball is another sport I enjoy watching. The Americans, Brasillians, Dutch, and Italians usually are the top teams. Italy's Carambula sure is entertaining to watch with his sky ball serves!  On a side note, Toronto is hosting an int'l beach vball tournament in Sept that's free to attend. I'd highly recommend going!  oh hell yea, those knuckling jump serves that come in flat, are insane to try to and handle.  Some of the rallies have been ridiculous! just put your hands in the way and hope for the best. i think its schmit for canada hitting OVER the blocks from 6'9 and 6'10 players, thats some serious hops
a couple of golds in the last 2 days, and something smelly at the dive centre.......  also an epic match between the US and Brazil mens Volleyball teams.

Opening ceremony is tomorrow night, and things aren't exactly off to a good start.  Check out these rooms that are unfinished with construction materials laying around as the athletes are moving in.  http://www.thescore.com/olym/news/1070965-jamaican-athletes-arrive-to-unfinished-rooms-at-rio-2016
It is unfortunate that some athletes could be at a disadvantage due to the rooms they are staying in.

Between this fiasco, corruption in the bidding process and politics of the Olympic Commitee and rampant drug use of some countries maybe it is time to fold the tent permanently on this spectacle.  edit : the saddest thing is seeing pictures of these derelict facilities 10 or more years down the road, what a waste

This Olympic Games every 2 years is becoming a lost cause. I read that host city hopefuls are backing out at great numbers for future fiascos. It has become nothing more than All Star pros playing each other. The amateurs that deserve to be there are home watching on TV a bunch of millionaires that want to add a Gold medal to their trophy cases, sad. Then there are the thousands of Rio citizens that have been thrown out of their tin shacks onto the streets to use the land for this disgusting show. Just the millions of dollars spent on creating a championship golf course in Rio could have housed every homeless person in that city. Basically golf does not exist in Brazil, only 2 other courses in Rio and they are private. What will they use it for next month?  If this were the last Olympic Games under the current format I will be quite happy.  I think Rory McElroy has it right.

Yea, cities have begun opening their eyes, the cost of the games is too high, think Vancouver is the only one that the games didn't hurt, in recent history.  But they had the world class facilities in place already, with Whistler for all the skiing events, and then an NHL arena.  Think the only thing they had to build was the village, bobsled and speed skating venue.  Rio was a very controversial venue right from the get go, many wondering why it was chosen to begin with.
MSN page is running this today, seen it before , must be a slow news day, sad.  http://www.msn.com/en-ca/news/photos/abandoned-olympic-venues/ss-BBuXUyo?li=AAggv0m

Knowing the amount of corruption and general Bull surrounding these games I couldn't be less interested. It's funny because I was driving around a bit this morning to different job sites and I don't think the Olympics was mentioned once on the FAN590 except for programming alerts. CBC radio on the other hand was trumpeting it pretty hard. Still strange though considering the opening ceremonies are tonight and Sportsnet is one of the programming partners, but the radio hosts didn't really even care to talk about it.

Only Olympic hype on the networks that are carrying it, no one cares, not here in Canada anyway. It's now a corporate bi annual event. I watched the opening ceremony for 2 total minutes, how exiting watching athletes walk and wave. What was with those carts with the pretty girls on them? I will watch the 100 meter final, and that is it.

What did Rory say?  Good points OI.  Im in no way shape or form interested in the illympic games these days.  Different story when I was a kiddo!  Oh and skateboarding just got added in 4 years???  Have fun with that gong show

i'll watch the track events, and volleyball, both beach and indoor.  and hope Canada can take gold in soccer this time round.  I refuse to watch basketball, because you already know whos going to win. at least with hockey its a crap shoot on whos going to win.
I guess "Olympic athlete lives don't matter"
watched this video the other day, great videohttp://www.news1130.com/2016/08/05/welcome-to-rio-the-beauty-beyond-the-dirty-air/
tear jerking moment here.https://www.facebook.com/CBCOlympics/videos/845363678928381/
Anyone see that poor gymnist break his leg?  ???
snapped it like a twig
That was brutal
In a state of shock however, he handles that like a champ!

There is so much negativity about the games and rightly so. To the media it makes a better story and if you don't like sports nothing can make you watch. It's the athletes that make it great. The achievements and the dedication to training to get there is something spectacular in itself.  Some of the upsets in competition and performances of a lifetime by up and comers can sure pull on the heart strings, at least with me anyhow. Go Canada Go!
you said it.  that second link i have posted there, the Canadian swimmer for the relay team is surprised by her parents during an interview.
Anyone see the bike crash? I thought the woman was dead. The Dutch cyclist ended up breaking her spine in 3 places
Anyone see the bike crash? I thought the woman was dead. The Dutch cyclist ended up breaking her spine in 3 places  i didn't hear about that one
Was watching on CbC and saw it. It was awful
was just reading about it, sounds like the racers weren't prepared despite ample time for training runs
Somebody peed in the diving pool since the last comp. It's all green now.
â€‹I have to admit I'm a fan of the games and amateur sport in general. I don't like the pros being allowed in the games.  I'm really liking the rugby sevens tourney.
